trans-unit.source: Update Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Update Storage Account

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Storage Account</languageKeyword> asynchronous operation updates the label, the description, and enables or disables the geo-replication status for the specified storage account.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Storage Account</languageKeyword> asynchronous operation updates the label, the description, and enables or disables the geo-replication status for the specified storage account.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Update Storage Account</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Update Storage Account</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;service-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID, and <codeInline>%%amp;lt;service-name%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the name of your storage account.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: PUT
trans-unit.target: PUT

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this header to <languageKeyword>application/xml</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: Set this header to <languageKeyword>application/xml</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header must be set to <userInput>2011-06-01</userInput> or higher.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header must be set to <userInput>2011-06-01</userInput> or higher.

trans-unit.source: The version should be at least "2012-03-01" to use the geo replication functionality.
trans-unit.target: The version should be at least "2012-03-01" to use the geo replication functionality.

trans-unit.source: The version should be at least "2013-06-01" to use the custom domain functionality.
trans-unit.target: The version should be at least "2013-06-01" to use the custom domain functionality.

trans-unit.source: The version should be at least “2013-11-01” to use SecondaryReadEnabled feature.
trans-unit.target: The version should be at least “2013-11-01” to use SecondaryReadEnabled feature.

trans-unit.source: The version should be at least “2014-06-01” to use the <parameterReference>AccountType</parameterReference> field.
trans-unit.target: The version should be at least “2014-06-01” to use the <parameterReference>AccountType</parameterReference> field.

trans-unit.source: Note that <parameterReference>GeoReplicationEnabled</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>SecondaryReadEnabled</parameterReference> are no longer supported moving forward – their functionality is included in <parameterReference>AccountType</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: Note that <parameterReference>GeoReplicationEnabled</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>SecondaryReadEnabled</parameterReference> are no longer supported moving forward – their functionality is included in <parameterReference>AccountType</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: The format of the request body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format of the request body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Element Name
trans-unit.target: Element Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a base-64 encoded name for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies a base-64 encoded name for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The label may be up to 100 characters in length.
trans-unit.target: The label may be up to 100 characters in length.

trans-unit.source: The label can be used identify the storage account for your tracking purposes.
trans-unit.target: The label can be used identify the storage account for your tracking purposes.

trans-unit.source: You must specify a value for either <languageKeyword>Label</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Description</languageKeyword>, or for both.
trans-unit.target: You must specify a value for either <languageKeyword>Label</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Description</languageKeyword>, or for both.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A description for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: A description for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.
trans-unit.target: The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.

trans-unit.source: You must specify a value for either <languageKeyword>Label</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Description</languageKeyword>, or for both.
trans-unit.target: You must specify a value for either <languageKeyword>Label</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Description</languageKeyword>, or for both.

trans-unit.source: GeoReplicationEnabled
trans-unit.target: GeoReplicationEnabled

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Enables or disables geo-replication on the specified the storage.
trans-unit.target: Enables or disables geo-replication on the specified the storage.

trans-unit.source: If set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, the data in the storage account is replicated across more than one geographic location so as to enable resilience in the face of catastrophic service loss.
trans-unit.target: If set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, the data in the storage account is replicated across more than one geographic location so as to enable resilience in the face of catastrophic service loss.

trans-unit.source: If set to <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, geo-replication is disabled.
trans-unit.target: If set to <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, geo-replication is disabled.

trans-unit.source: If the element is not included in the request body, the current value is left unchanged.
trans-unit.target: If the element is not included in the request body, the current value is left unchanged.

trans-unit.source: If you have enabled geo-replication you can elect to disable it by setting this element to false.
trans-unit.target: If you have enabled geo-replication you can elect to disable it by setting this element to false.

trans-unit.source: When disabled, your data is no longer replicated to a secondary data center and any data in the secondary location will be removed.
trans-unit.target: When disabled, your data is no longer replicated to a secondary data center and any data in the secondary location will be removed.

trans-unit.source: Enabling geo-replication once it has been disabled will result in the storage account being billed for replicating the current copy of data to the secondary data center.
trans-unit.target: Enabling geo-replication once it has been disabled will result in the storage account being billed for replicating the current copy of data to the secondary data center.

trans-unit.source: After the existing copy of the data is replicated to the secondary data center, updates are geo-replicated at no additional charge.
trans-unit.target: After the existing copy of the data is replicated to the secondary data center, updates are geo-replicated at no additional charge.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>GeoReplicationEnabled</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher and is replaced by the AccountType element with version 2014-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>GeoReplicationEnabled</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher and is replaced by the AccountType element with version 2014-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name and value of an extended property that was added to the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name and value of an extended property that was added to the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the custom domains that are associated with the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the custom domains that are associated with the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>CustomDomains</embeddedLabel> element is only available using version 2013-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>CustomDomains</embeddedLabel> element is only available using version 2013-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: SecondaryReadEnabled
trans-unit.target: SecondaryReadEnabled

trans-unit.source: Indicates that secondary read is enabled for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that secondary read is enabled for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>SecondaryReadEnabled</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher and is replaced by the AccountType element with version 2014-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>SecondaryReadEnabled</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher and is replaced by the AccountType element with version 2014-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: AccountType
trans-unit.target: AccountType

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the account supports locally-redundant storage, geo-redundant storage, or read access geo-redundant storage.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the account supports locally-redundant storage, geo-redundant storage, or read access geo-redundant storage.

trans-unit.source: Zone-redundant storage is not an option when you update a storage account.
trans-unit.target: Zone-redundant storage is not an option when you update a storage account.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>AccountType</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher and it replaces the SecondaryReadEnabled and GeoReplicationEnabled elements.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>AccountType</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher and it replaces the SecondaryReadEnabled and GeoReplicationEnabled elements.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Standard_ZRS</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>Premium_LRS</languageKeyword> account types are not an option because those accounts cannot be changed to any other account type.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Standard_ZRS</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>Premium_LRS</languageKeyword> account types are not an option because those accounts cannot be changed to any other account type.

trans-unit.source: Also, all other account types cannot be changed to <languageKeyword>Standard_ZRS</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Premium_LRS</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: Also, all other account types cannot be changed to <languageKeyword>Standard_ZRS</languageKeyword> or <languageKeyword>Premium_LRS</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: ExtendedProperties
trans-unit.target: ExtendedProperties

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name and value of an extended property that was added to the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name and value of an extended property that was added to the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Represents the name of an extended storage account property.
trans-unit.target: Represents the name of an extended storage account property.

trans-unit.source: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.
trans-unit.target: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.

trans-unit.source: You can have a maximum of 50 extended property name/value pairs.
trans-unit.target: You can have a maximum of 50 extended property name/value pairs.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length of the Name element is 64 characters, only alphanumeric characters and underscores are valid in the Name, and the name must start with a letter.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length of the Name element is 64 characters, only alphanumeric characters and underscores are valid in the Name, and the name must start with a letter.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to use other characters, starting the Name with a non-letter character, or entering a name that is identical to that of another extended property owned by the same storage account, will result in a status code 400 (Bad Request) error.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to use other characters, starting the Name with a non-letter character, or entering a name that is identical to that of another extended property owned by the same storage account, will result in a status code 400 (Bad Request) error.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Name</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Name</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Represents the value of an extended storage account property.
trans-unit.target: Represents the value of an extended storage account property.

trans-unit.source: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.
trans-unit.target: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.

trans-unit.source: You can have a maximum of 50 extended property name/value pairs, and each extended property value has a maximum length of 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: You can have a maximum of 50 extended property name/value pairs, and each extended property value has a maximum length of 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Value</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Value</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: CustomDomains
trans-unit.target: CustomDomains

trans-unit.source: Specifies the custom domains that are associated with the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the custom domains that are associated with the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: CustomDomain
trans-unit.target: CustomDomain

trans-unit.source: Specifies information about a custom domain that is associated with the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Specifies information about a custom domain that is associated with the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the custom domain.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the custom domain.

trans-unit.source: UseSubDomainName
trans-unit.target: UseSubDomainName

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether indirect CName validation is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Indicates whether indirect CName validation is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.

trans-unit.source: For an asynchronous operation, you can call <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> with the value of the header to determine whether the operation is complete, has failed, or is still in progress.
trans-unit.target: For an asynchronous operation, you can call <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> with the value of the header to determine whether the operation is complete, has failed, or is still in progress.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: Use the <languageKeyword>Update Storage Account</languageKeyword> operation to change the description, label, or geo-replication setting value for a storage account.
trans-unit.target: Use the <languageKeyword>Update Storage Account</languageKeyword> operation to change the description, label, or geo-replication setting value for a storage account.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link> operation to review these values.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link> operation to review these values.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following example calls the <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link> operation to list the initial property values for the storage account, updates the <parameterReference>Label</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Description</parameterReference> properties with a call to the <languageKeyword>Update Storage Account</languageKeyword> operation, then displays the updated results with another call to <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link>.
trans-unit.target: The following example calls the <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link> operation to list the initial property values for the storage account, updates the <parameterReference>Label</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>Description</parameterReference> properties with a call to the <languageKeyword>Update Storage Account</languageKeyword> operation, then displays the updated results with another call to <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link>.

trans-unit.source: Change the value of the <codeInline>Version</codeInline> string to the desired version, the <codeInline>Thumbprint</codeInline> value to the thumbprint for your management certificate, the <codeInline>SubscriptionId</codeInline> to your subscription identifier, and the <codeInline>ServiceName</codeInline> value to the name of your storage account to run the sample.
trans-unit.target: Change the value of the <codeInline>Version</codeInline> string to the desired version, the <codeInline>Thumbprint</codeInline> value to the thumbprint for your management certificate, the <codeInline>SubscriptionId</codeInline> to your subscription identifier, and the <codeInline>ServiceName</codeInline> value to the name of your storage account to run the sample.

trans-unit.source: When run, the example program will generate output something like the following:
trans-unit.target: When run, the example program will generate output something like the following:
